Package fr.utt.lo02.projet.controleur

Class MouseCliquer

java.lang.Object
java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
fr.utt.lo02.projet.controleur.MouseCliquer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.util.EventListener
public class MouseCliquer
extends java.awt.event.MouseAdapter
The class MouseCliquer is used to handle mouse click events during game play
Version:
1.0
Author:
Dewen WU

    int[] getCoordinate​(int x, int y)
    Transform the coordinates of mouse clicks to the coordinates of the layout
    boolean isACardHand​(int x, int y)
    Determine whether the coordinates pinter is the position of the card in the hand If it is the position of the card in the hand, then set the attribute xyCardMain
    void mousePressed​(java.awt.event.MouseEvent e)
    The listener method of mouse pressed This method is used to get the coordinates of the mouse click and to place or move the cards according to the clicked coordinates.
    void setChoiceCardHand​(Joueur joueur)
    Initialize the action of playing a card of mode advanced via clicking the mouse This method is called by class ModeAdvanced
    void setMoveCard​(Joueur joueur)
    Initialize the action of moving a card via clicking the mouse This method is called by class ModeJeu
    void setPlayCard​(Joueur joueur, Carte carteMain)
    Initialize the action of playing a card of mode normal via clicking the mouse This method is called by class ModeNormal
    void terminerLeJeu()
    When the game is over, to display the scores of each player and the winner who got the highest score

    • isACardHand

      public boolean isACardHand​(int x, int y)
      Determine whether the coordinates pinter is the position of the card in the hand If it is the position of the card in the hand, then set the attribute xyCardMain
      Parameters:
      x - x coordinates of the mouse pointer
      y - y coordinates of the mouse pointer
      Returns:
      true if the coordinates pointer is the position of the card in the hand
